about.title: About the Company
about.subtitle: Adi and Shira lead the company with international experience in construction and architecture.
about.adiBio: Born in 1997, Adi is a Civil Engineering graduate with over 10 years of hands-on experience in the construction industry. He has worked with leading companies, managing diverse projects from residential buildings to large-scale infrastructure. Adi specializes in site management, safety supervision, and integrating innovative construction methods. Passionate about architecture and engineering from a young age, he is committed to delivering projects with reliability, precision, and international standards.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This website (https://uzan-group.com) is operated by A&S UZAN GROUP CO., LTD ('the Company', 'we', 'our'). We are committed to protecting your privacy under Thailand’s Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) and international standards.

1.title: 1. Data Collection
content: We may collect personal information such as full name, phone number, email, and messages submitted via forms.
Technical data such as IP address, device type, browser information, and cookies may also be collected for analytics.

2.title: 2. Purpose of Data Use
content: To operate and improve our website, provide services, respond to inquiries, send updates (with consent), ensure security, and comply with legal obligations.
All processing is conducted lawfully and transparently under the PDPA.

3.title: 3. Data Retention
content: Data is securely stored in Thailand or in countries offering adequate protection under the PDPA.
We implement strong security measures including encryption, access control, and periodic backups.

4.title: 4. Sharing Data with Third Parties
content: We may share information with service providers (hosting, maintenance, security, analytics) bound by confidentiality agreements.
Data may also be disclosed when required by law or court order.

5.title: 5. Your Rights
content: Under Thailand’s PDPA, you have the right to access, correct, delete, object to processing, and request data portability.
